properties.description: The resource-specific properties for this resource.

AuthorizationBasicRule.description: BasicRules of AuthorizationConfig Polar rules are not supported

brokerResources.description: This subfield defines the broker resources that the Basic Rule is applied on.

principals.description: This subfield defines the identities that represent the clients.

enableCache.description: Enable caching of the authorization rules.

rules.description: Authorization Rules to be used. If no rule is set, but Authorization Resource is used that would mean DenyAll.

AutomaticCertMethod.description: Automatic TLS server certificate management with cert-manager

renewBefore.description: When to begin renewing automatically-managed certificate.

san.description: Additional SANs to include in the certificate.

secretName.description: Secret for storing server certificate. Any existing data will be overwritten.

secretNamespace.description: Certificate K8S namespace. Omit to use default namespace.

BackendChain.description: Desired properties of the Frontend Instances of the DMQTT Broker

partitions.description: Partitions is desired number of physical backend chains of the given distributed MQTT broker.

redundancyFactor.description: Redundancy Factor is desired numbers of broker instances in one chain.

temporaryDiskTransferEnabled.description: Defines whether disk transfer is enabled or not.

temporaryDiskTransferHighWatermarkPercen.description: Defines the percentage usage of buffer pool above which disk transfer will start.

temporaryDiskTransferLowWatermarkPercent.description: Defines the percentage usage of buffer pool below which disk transfer will stop.

temporaryMaxBackendMemUsagePercent.description: Defines the limits for memory usage percent of the backend instances of the MQTT broker.

temporaryResourceLimits.description: Defines the limits for resources of the backend instances of the MQTT broker.

workers.description: Number of logical backend workers per pod.

authenticationMethods.description: The list of authentication methods supported by the Authentication Resource. For each array element, NOTE - Enum only authenticator type supported.

listenerRef.description: The array of listener Resources it supports.

BrokerAuthenticatorCustomAuthX509.description: X509 Custom Authentication properties. NOTE - Enum only authenticator type supported at a time.

secretName.description: Secret where cert details are stored.

caCertConfigMap.description: CA cert config map to use.

agentSocketPath.description: Mounted socket path for spiffe agent.

identityMaxRetry.description: Maximum number of re-tries to fetch identity.

identityWaitRetryMs.description: Maximum time to wait before fetching identity again.

secretName.description: Secret where username and password are stored.

attributes.description: K8S Secret name to mount for username and password.

trustedClientCaCertConfigMap.description: Trusted client ca cert config map.

BrokerAuthenticatorMethodX509Attributes.description: BrokerAuthenticatorMethodX509Attributes properties. NOTE - Enum only type supported at a time.

secretName.description: Secret where x509 attributes are stored.

BrokerAuthenticatorMethods.description: Collection of different CrdAuthenticator methods of Broker Resource. NOTE Enum - Only one method is supported for each entry.

authorizationPolicies.description: The list of authorization policies supported by the Authorization Resource.

listenerRef.description: The array of listener Resources it supports.

enableMetrics.description: Knob to enable/disable metrics. Default = true

enableSelfCheck.description: Enable self check on Broker via Probe.

enableSelfTracing.description: Enable self tracing on the Broker so that every selfCheckFrequencySeconds a random message is traced even if it didn't have trace context.

enableTracing.description: Knob to enable/disable entire tracing infrastructure.

maxCellMapLifetime.description: Maximum time for the CellMap to live.

selfCheckFrequencySeconds.description: Frequency for the self check to run.

selfCheckTimeoutSeconds.description: Time out period of the self check.

selfTraceFrequencySeconds.description: The frequency at which selfTrace should run.

spanChannelCapacity.description: The number of the spans generated by the Tracing.

authenticationEnabled.description: The flag for enabling Authentication rules on Listener Port.

authorizationEnabled.description: The flag for enabling Authorization policies on Listener Port. false - AllowAll, true - Use Authorization resource rules if present.

brokerRef.description: The k8s cr/resource reference of mq/broker.

nodePort.description: The node port to use on the Host node.

port.description: The port to start Listening for connections on.

serviceName.description: The service name to expose Listener port on.

serviceType.description: The Kubernetes Service type to deploy for Listener.

tls.description: Defines configuration of a TLS server certificate. NOTE Enum - Only one TLS Cert method is supported

authImage.description: The details of Authentication Docker Image.

brokerImage.description: The details of Broker Docker Image.

brokerNodeTolerations.description: The details of Node Tolerations for Broker Pods.

cardinality.description: The cardinality details of the broker.

diagnostics.description: The diagnostic details of the broker deployment.

diskBackedMessageBufferSettings.description: The settings of the disk-backed message buffer.

encryptInternalTraffic.description: The setting to enable or disable encryption of internal Traffic.

healthManagerImage.description: The details of Health Manager Docker Image.

healthManagerNodeTolerations.description: The details of Node Tolerations for Health Manager Pods.

internalCerts.description: Details of the internal CA cert that will be used to secure communication between pods.

mode.description: The Running Mode of the Broker Deployment.

renewBefore.description: Renew before time of CA cert.

maxMessagesPerBatch.description: Maximum messages to send per Batch.

image.description: The details of DataLakeConnector Docker Image.

instances.description: The number of DataLakeConnector pods to spin up.

localBrokerConnection.description: The details for connecting with Local Broker.

logLevel.description: The log level of the DataLake Connector instances.

nodeTolerations.description: The Node Tolerations for the DataLake Connector pods.

protocol.description: The protocol to use for connecting with Brokers.

target.description: The protocol to use for connecting with Brokers. NOTE - Enum only storage is supported at at time.

endpoint.description: DataLake fabric storage endpoint to use.

authentication.description: DataLake service storage authentication details. NOTE - Enum only one method is supported.

endpoint.description: DataLake service storage endpoint to use.

DataLakeServiceStorageAuthentication.description: DataLake Service Storage authentication details. NOTE - Enum only one method is supported.

DataLakeTargetStorage.description: Target storage for the DataLake. NOTE - Enum only storage is supported at a time.

dataExportFrequencySeconds.description: The frequency at which the data will be exported.

image.description: The details of Diagnostic Service Docker Image.

logFormat.description: The format for the logs generated.

logLevel.description: The format for the logs generated.

maxDataStorageSize.description: The maximum data stored in MiB.

metricsPort.description: The port at which metrics is exposed.

openTelemetryTracesCollectorAddr.description: The destination to collect traces. Diagnostic service will push traces to this endpoint

ephemeralVolumeClaimSpec.description: Use the specified persistent volume claim template to mount a "generic ephemeral volume" for the message buffer. See <https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/ephemeral-volumes/#generic-ephemeral-volumes> for details.

maxSize.description: The max size of the message buffer on disk. If a PVC template is specified using one of ephemeralVolumeClaimSpec or persistentVolumeClaimSpec, then this size is used as the request and limit sizes of that template. If neither ephemeralVolumeClaimSpec nor persistentVolumeClaimSpec are specified, then an emptyDir volume is mounted with this size as its limit. See <https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/volumes/#emptydir> for details.

persistentVolumeClaimSpec.description: Use the specified persistent volume claim template to mount a persistent volume for the message buffer.

name.description: The name of the extended location.

Frontend.description: Desired properties of the Frontend Instances of the DMQTT Broker

replicas.description: Replicas is desired number of frontend replicas of the given distributed MQTT broker.

temporaryResourceLimits.description: Defines the limits for resources of the frontend instances of the MQTT broker.

workers.description: Number of logical frontend workers per pod.

clientIdPrefix.description: The client id prefix of the dynamically generated client ids.

image.description: The details of KafkaConnector Docker Image.

instances.description: The number of KafkaConnector pods to spin up.

kafkaConnection.description: The details for connecting with Remote Kafka Broker.

localBrokerConnection.description: The details for connecting with Local Broker.

logLevel.description: The log level of the Bridge Connector instances.

nodeTolerations.description: The Node Tolerations for the Bridge Connector pods.

authType.description: The type of authentication to use for Kafka remote broker.

enabled.description: If authentication is enabled for Kafka remote broker.

KafkaRemoteBrokerAuthenticationTypes.description: Kafka RemoteBrokerConnection Authentication types. NOTE - Enum only one method is allowed to be passed.

systemAssignedManagedIdentity.description: Managed identity remote broker authentication method.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of remote broker to connect to.

tls.description: TLS details for Remote broker Connection.

tlsEnabled.description: Tls Enabled on Remote Broker Connection.

trustedCaCertificateConfigMap.description: Trusted CA certificate name for Remote Broker.

KafkaRoutes.description: Kafka Routes properties. NOTE - Enum only one method is allowed to be passed.

groupMinimumShareNumber.description: The minimum number to use in a group for subscription.

groupName.description: The name of the shared subscription.

consumerGroupId.description: The consumer group id to use.

kafkaTopic.description: The kafka topic to pull from.

mqttTopic.description: The mqtt topic to publish to.

qos.description: The qos to use for mqtt.

enabled.description: The setting to enable or disable batching.

maxBytes.description: The maximum bytes to send in a batch.

maxMessages.description: The maximum messages to send in a batch.

batching.description: The batching settings for kafka messages.

compression.description: The compression to use for kafka messages.

copyMqttProperties.description: The flag to copy Mqtt properties.

kafkaConnectorRef.description: The kafkaConnector CRD it refers to.

partitionKeyProperty.description: The partition to use for Kafka.

partitionStrategy.description: The partition strategy to use for Kafka.

routes.description: The route details for Kafka connector.

secretName.description: Secret where cert details are stored.

KeyVaultCredentialsProperties.description: KeyVault credentials properties. NOTE - Future this will be ENUM.

servicePrincipalLocalSecretName.description: KeyVault service principal local secret name.

LocalBrokerAuthenticationMethods.description: Mqtt Local Broker Authentication details. Only one method at a time is supported. Default - kubernetes authentication

authentication.description: The authentication methods for LocalBroker connection. NOTE - Enum only one method at a time is supported.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of local broker to connect to.

tls.description: TLS details for Local broker Connection.

LocalBrokerConnectionTls.description: Mqtt Local Broker Connection TLS details

tlsEnabled.description: Tls Enabled on Local Broker Connection.

trustedCaCertificateConfigMap.description: Trusted CA certificate config map name for Local Broker.

secretPath.description: Secret Path where SAT is mounted.

serviceAccountTokenName.description: Token name where SAT is mounted on secret path.

ManualCertMethod.description: Manual TLS server certificate management through a defined secret

secretNamespace.description: namespace of secret; omit to use default namespace.

bridgeInstances.description: The number of instances to deploy for a bridge rollout.

clientIdPrefix.description: The client id prefix of the dynamically generated client ids.

image.description: The details of MqttBridge Docker Image.

localBrokerConnection.description: The details for connecting with Local Broker.

logLevel.description: The log level of the Bridge Connector instances.

nodeTolerations.description: The Node Tolerations for the Bridge Connector pods.

protocol.description: The protocol to use for connecting with Brokers.

remoteBrokerConnection.description: The details for connecting with Remote Broker.

MqttBridgeRemoteBrokerAuthenticationMeth.description: MqttBridge RemoteBrokerConnection Authentication methods. NOTE - Enum only one is allowed to be passed.

systemAssignedManagedIdentity.description: Managed identity remote broker authentication method.

authentication.description: The remote broker authentication methods. NOTE - Enum only one method is allowed to be passed.

endpoint.description: The endpoint of remote broker to connect to.

tls.description: TLS details for Remote broker Connection.

tlsEnabled.description: Tls Enabled on Remote Broker Connection.

trustedCaCertificateConfigMap.description: Trusted CA certificate name for Remote Broker.

secretName.description: Secret where cert details are stored.

groupMinimumShareNumber.description: The group shared subscription minimum share number.

groupName.description: The group name for Shared subscription.

target.description: Target topic of the route. Ignore if same as source

mqttBridgeConnectorRef.description: The MqttBridgeConnector CRD it refers to.

routes.description: The route details for MqttBridge connector.

kafkaTopic.description: The kafka topic to publish to.

mqttTopic.description: The mqtt topic to pull from.

qos.description: The qos to use for mqtt.

attributes.description: A list of key-value pairs that match the attributes of the clients. The attributes are case-sensitive and must match the attributes provided by the clients during authentication.

clientids.description: A list of client IDs that match the clients. The client IDs are case-sensitive and must match the client IDs provided by the clients during connection.

usernames.description: A list of usernames that match the clients. The usernames are case-sensitive and must match the usernames provided by the clients during authentication.

ResourceInfoDefinition.description: ResourceInfoDefinition properties of Basic Rule. This defines the objects that represent the actions or topics, such as - method.Connect, method.Publish, etc.

method.description: The type of action that the clients can perform on the broker: Connect, Publish or Subscribe.

topics.description: A list of topics or topic patterns that match the topics that the clients can publish or subscribe to. This subfield is required if the method is Publish or Subscribe.

saslType.description: Sasl Mechanism for remote broker authentication.

token.description: Sasl token for remote broker authentication.

SaslRemoteBrokerBasicAuthenticationToken.description: Kafka RemoteBrokerConnection Sasl Authentication token properties. NOTE - Enum only one method is allowed to be passed.

secretName.description: Secret where cert details are stored.

TemporaryResourceLimitsConfig.description: Internal knobs of Resource Limits for FE and BE

maxInflightMessages.description: Maximum number of messages a client can have inflight.

maxInflightPatches.description: Maximum number of patch inflight per node.

maxInflightPatchesPerClient.description: Maximum number of patch a client can have in flight.

maxMessageExpirySecs.description: Maximum message expiry interval, in seconds.

maxQueuedQos0Messages.description: Maximum receive QoS0 for external clients.

maxSessionExpirySecs.description: Maximum session expiry interval, in seconds.

TlsCertMethod.description: Collection of different TLS types, NOTE- Enum at a time only one of them needs to be supported

automatic.description: Option 1 - Automatic TLS server certificate management with cert-manager.

keyVault.description: Option 3 - TLS server certificate retrieved from Key Vault..

manual.description: Option 2 - Manual TLS server certificate management through a defined secret.

apiGroup.description: APIGroup is the group for the resource being referenced. If APIGroup is not specified, the specified Kind must be in the core API group. For any other third-party types, APIGroup is required.

kind.description: Kind is the type of resource being referenced

name.description: Name is the name of resource being referenced

apiGroup.description: APIGroup is the group for the resource being referenced. If APIGroup is not specified, the specified Kind must be in the core API group. For any other third-party types, APIGroup is required.

kind.description: Kind is the type of resource being referenced

name.description: Name is the name of resource being referenced

limits.description: Limits describes the maximum amount of compute resources allowed. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

requests.description: Requests describes the minimum amount of compute resources required. If Requests is omitted for a container, it defaults to Limits if that is explicitly specified, otherwise to an implementation-defined value. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/configuration/manage-resources-containers/

accessModes.description: AccessModes contains the desired access modes the volume should have. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#access-modes-1

dataSource.description: This field can be used to specify either: * An existing VolumeSnapshot object (snapshot.storage.k8s.io/VolumeSnapshot) * An existing PVC (PersistentVolumeClaim) If the provisioner or an external controller can support the specified data source, it will create a new volume based on the contents of the specified data source. If the AnyVolumeDataSource feature gate is enabled, this field will always have the same contents as the DataSourceRef field.

dataSourceRef.description: Specifies the object from which to populate the volume with data, if a non-empty volume is desired. This may be any local object from a non-empty API group (non core object) or a PersistentVolumeClaim object. When this field is specified, volume binding will only succeed if the type of the specified object matches some installed volume populator or dynamic provisioner. This field will replace the functionality of the DataSource field and as such if both fields are non-empty, they must have the same value. For backwards compatibility, both fields (DataSource and DataSourceRef) will be set to the same value automatically if one of them is empty and the other is non-empty. There are two important differences between DataSource and DataSourceRef: * While DataSource only allows two specific types of objects, DataSourceRef allows any non-core object, as well as PersistentVolumeClaim objects. * While DataSource ignores disallowed values (dropping them), DataSourceRef preserves all values, and generates an error if a disallowed value is specified. (Alpha) Using this field requires the AnyVolumeDataSource feature gate to be enabled.

resources.description: Resources represents the minimum resources the volume should have. If RecoverVolumeExpansionFailure feature is enabled users are allowed to specify resource requirements that are lower than previous value but must still be higher than capacity recorded in the status field of the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#resources

selector.description: A label query over volumes to consider for binding.

storageClassName.description: Name of the StorageClass required by the claim. More info: https://kubernetes.io/docs/concepts/storage/persistent-volumes#class-1

volumeMode.description: volumeMode defines what type of volume is required by the claim. Value of Filesystem is implied when not included in claim spec. This is a beta feature.

volumeName.description: VolumeName is the binding reference to the PersistentVolume backing this claim.

matchExpressions.description: MatchExpressions is a list of label selector requirements. The requirements are ANDed.

matchLabels.description: MatchLabels is a map of {key,value} pairs. A single {key,value} in the matchLabels map is equivalent to an element of matchExpressions, whose key field is "key", the operator is "In", and the values array contains only "value". The requirements are ANDed.

key.description: key is the label key that the selector applies to.

operator.description: operator represents a key's relationship to a set of values. Valid operators are In, NotIn, Exists and DoesNotExist.

values.description: values is an array of string values. If the operator is In or NotIn, the values array must be non-empty. If the operator is Exists or DoesNotExist, the values array must be empty. This array is replaced during a strategic merge patch.
